messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] unschooler kids' books AND origin of words
messages.msgSnippet: ... I second this endorsement!  And besides spurring thought about the true origin of everyday words and being fun to read, Frindle plays on some strong
messages.messageBody:
joylyn@... writes:


> One great book that deals with this is Frindle. It's a quick read, OK
> for kids of all ages, and is a cute book.
>
>


I second this endorsement! And besides spurring thought about the
true origin of everyday words and being fun to read, "Frindle" plays on some
strong unschooling themes -- like finding your own voice, standing up for what you
believe against authority, even against friends and family (and
realistically, about the price that sometimes must be paid.) In that way, it's similar to
Pam's movie recommendation of Strictly Ballroom, except with words instead of
dancing. <g> JJ


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
